heading: 1.1 C.elegans plate experiment
text:
experiment, adult C.elegans nematodes exposed varying concentrations different compounds.
data used exercise supplied y J. Louter (INT/ILC).first review Excel file data. file called ./data.CE.LIQ.FLOW.062_Tidydata.xlsx.
Something stood different compounds measured nM. ethanol meduim cells measured percentage.compounds used experiment : 2,6-diisopropylnaphthalene, Decane Naphthalene positive control group 1,5% Ethanol S-Medium negative control group just S-Medium.loading data Rstudio asked inspect data types columns: RawData, compName compConcentration types expected.
expect RawData: Numeric/integer, compName: factor compConcentration: numeric/double.
typeof function tells RawData double. doesn’t contain decimals integer big problem analyses. CompName set character factor. CompConcentration character. odd since column contains numbers decimals double.
means data types correctly assigned importing data R.reassigning datatypes plotting first plot. compConcentration x-axis RawData y-axis. Also level compName got colour level expType got shape.can see x-axis placed alphabetic order numerical order. type compConcentration ‘character’ ‘double’.Let’s reassign datatypes correct onesAnd let’s check types !Now fixed, let’s see plot looks like.get clearer view, log10 transformation added x-axis. Also bit jitter added can see individual dots better. ’ve also separated component.positive control experiments Ethanol (expType controlPositive excel file).
negative control experiment S-Medium (expType controlNegative excel file).possible analysis;
see indeed effect different concentrations offspring count ’d start Shapiro-Wilk test normalize data
code:
elegansData <- read_excel(here("port_data/CE.LIQ.FLOW.062_Tidydata.xlsx"))
tibble(elegansData)## # A tibble: 360 × 34
##    plateRow plateCo…¹ vialNr dropC…² expType expRe…³ expName expDate            
##    <lgl>    <lgl>      <dbl> <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <dttm>             
##  1 NA       NA             1 a       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  2 NA       NA             1 b       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  3 NA       NA             1 c       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  4 NA       NA             1 d       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  5 NA       NA             1 e       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  6 NA       NA             2 a       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  7 NA       NA             2 b       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  8 NA       NA             2 c       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
##  9 NA       NA             2 d       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
## 10 NA       NA             2 e       experi…       3 CE.LIQ… 2020-11-30 00:00:00
## # … with 350 more rows, 26 more variables: expResearcher <chr>, expTime <dbl>,
## #   expUnit <chr>, expVolumeCounted <dbl>, RawData <dbl>, compCASRN <chr>,
## #   compName <chr>, compConcentration <chr>, compUnit <chr>,
## #   compDelivery <chr>, compVehicle <chr>, elegansStrain <chr>,
## #   elegansInput <dbl>, bacterialStrain <chr>, bacterialTreatment <chr>,
## #   bacterialOD600 <dbl>, bacterialConcX <dbl>, bacterialVolume <dbl>,
## #   bacterialVolUnit <chr>, incubationVial <chr>, incubationVolume <dbl>, …
typeof(elegansData$RawData)## [1] "double"
typeof(elegansData$compName)## [1] "character"
typeof(elegansData$compConcentration)## [1] "character"
  ggplot(elegansData, aes(x=compConcentration, y=RawData, shape=expType, colour=compName))+
  geom_point()+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust=1))+
  labs(colour="Component name", shape="Experiment type",
       x="Component Concentration",
       y="Amount of offspring",
       title="Amount offspring C.elegans after being exposed to diffirent componentens",
       subtitle= "Amount of offspring after 68 hours"
)## Warning: Removed 5 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
elegansData$RawData <- as.integer(elegansData$RawData)
elegansData$compName <- as.factor(elegansData$compName)
elegansData$compConcentration <- as.numeric(elegansData$compConcentration)
class(elegansData$RawData)## [1] "integer"
class(elegansData$compName)## [1] "factor"
typeof(elegansData$compConcentration)## [1] "double"
ggplot(elegansData, aes(x=compConcentration, y=RawData, shape=expType, colour=compName, label=round(compConcentration, digits = 3)))+
  geom_point()+
  labs(colour="Component name", shape="Experiment type",
       x="Component Concentration",
       y="Amount of offspring",
       title="Amount offspring C.elegans after being exposed to diffirent componentens",
       subtitle= "Amount of offspring after 68 hours"
)## Warning: Removed 6 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
elegansData_nM <- elegansData %>% filter(compUnit == "nM")

  ggplot(elegansData_nM, aes(x=log10(compConcentration), y=RawData, colour=compName))+
  geom_point(position = position_jitter(h=0.15,w=0.15), show.legend=FALSE)+
  scale_x_continuous()+
  labs(colour="Component name", shape="Experiment type",
       x="Component Concentration (log10)",
       y="Amount of offspring",
       title="Amount offspring C.elegans after being exposed to diffirent componentens",
       subtitle= "Amount of offspring after 68 hours",
       legend
)+
  facet_wrap(~compName)## Warning: Removed 6 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
elegansData_pct <- elegansData %>% filter(compUnit == "pct")

ggplot(elegansData_pct, aes(x=compConcentration, y=RawData, shape=expType, colour=compName))+
  geom_point(position = position_jitter(h=0.1,w=0.1))+
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, 120))+
  labs(colour="Component name", shape="Experiment type",
       x="Component Concentration (log10)",
       y="Amount of offspring",
       title="Amount offspring C.elegans after being exposed to diffirent componentens",
       subtitle= "Amount of offspring after 68 hours"
)
MeanOfDataCtrlNeg <- elegansData %>% filter(expType == "controlNegative") %>% summarize(mean = mean(RawData, na.rm = TRUE))

NormCelegansData <- elegansData %>%
  select(RawData, compName, compConcentration, expType, compUnit) %>% na.omit() %>%
  mutate(normalized = RawData/MeanOfDataCtrlNeg$mean)


elegansData_nM <- NormCelegansData %>% filter(compUnit == "nM")

  ggplot(elegansData_nM, aes(x=log10(compConcentration), y=normalized, colour=compName))+
  geom_point(position = position_jitter(h=0.15,w=0.15), show.legend=FALSE)+
  scale_x_continuous()+
  labs(colour="Component name", shape="Experiment type",
       x="Component Concentration (log10)",
       y="Amount of offspring",
       title="Amount offspring C.elegans after being exposed to diffirent componentens",
       subtitle= "Amount of offspring after 68 hours",
       legend
)+
  facet_wrap(~compName)
elegansData_pct <- NormCelegansData %>% filter(compUnit == "pct")

ggplot(elegansData_pct, aes(x=compConcentration, y=normalized, shape=expType, colour=compName))+
  geom_point(position = position_jitter(h=0.1,w=0.1))+
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, 1.5))+
  labs(colour="Component name", shape="Experiment type",
       x="Component Concentration (log10)",
       y="Amount of offspring",
       title="Amount offspring C.elegans after being exposed to diffirent componentens",
       subtitle= "Amount of offspring after 68 hours"
)
